definition[0]: not paying enough attention to what you are doing, so that you make mistakes, damage things etc
example[0]: It was careless of him to leave the door unlocked.
example[3]: Careless talk can be disastrous for a business.
example[4]: He’s careless with his glasses and has lost three pairs.
definition[1]: natural and not done with any deliberate effort or attention
example[5]: He ran a hand through his hair with a careless gesture.
example[7]: a man careless of his own safety
example[8]: I made a few careless mistakes.
example[9]: It was careless of you to leave your purse lying about.
example[10]: He started getting careless about taking his medication.
definition[3]: often dropping or breaking things because you move around in a careless way
example[11]: I’m so clumsy, I spilt milk all over the floor.
definition[4]: careless and lazy in the way you do your work or in your behaviour generally
example[13]: As a student, he was brilliant but sloppy.
example[14]: I will not tolerate sloppy work.
definition[5]: doing dangerous or stupid things without thinking about your own or other people’s safety
example[15]: The driver of the car was arrested for reckless driving.
example[16]: His actions showed a reckless disregard for human life.
definition[6]: careless in a way that might affect other people, especially when you should be taking care of them
example[17]: It’s irresponsible for parents to let their children smoke.
example[18]: his irresponsible attitude to keeping animals
definition[7]: carelessly saying something that upsets or embarrasses someone, without intending to do this
example[19]: He kept making tactless remarks about her appearance.
example[21]: I thought it would be tactless to ask about her divorce.
definition[8]: not being careful enough about something and treating it as though it is not important
example[22]: He seems to have a very casual attitude towards his work.
example[23]: She disliked the casual way in which he made decisions affecting other people’s lives.
definition[9]: careless about something that you are responsible for, so that serious mistakes are made – used especially when someone will be officially punished for this
example[24]: The doctor was negligent in using the wrong type of needle.
example[25]: They found him guilty of negligent conduct.
